explanation:
Agent A's report is correct in the context of the provided project. The call to OS_FileSysFormatVolume_Impl(&token) is an executed operation that (in this build) has no side effects and always returns OS_SUCCESS. Removing that call (and the associated assignment to return_code) would not change the observable program behaviour here (other than trivial timing), so it meets the definition of dead code in MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.2.

Caveats:
- If the project can be built for other targets where OS_FileSysFormatVolume_Impl is implemented with real effects (or the symbol can be overridden at link time), then the call would not be dead in those configurations.
- Note 1 to Rule 2.2 points out timing can be part of behaviour for embedded systems; if the timing difference introduced by calling the no-op is significant for this system, that could affect the classification. From the supplied code and logs there is no indication of meaningful timing side-effects.

Recommendation: either remove the redundant call in this configuration, or (preferably) document the rationale and conditionally compile or guard the call so that the implementation does not contain executed no-op code across the project configuration being analyzed.
